title: Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Somewhat less than a quarter is shown. Pair fo gaines support the octagonal central framing, over which the top part of an ovoidal colonnade is shown. An ovoidal niche with a bust fills an interval between the gaines. A semi circular landscape under a pointed arch in the corner.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1504.
